content:
New-AzureRmAppServicePlan

Creates an Azure App Service plan in a given Geo location.

In this Article

Syntax

New-AzureRmAppServicePlan [-ResourceGroupName] <String> [-Name] <String> [-Location] <String>
 [[-Tier] <String>] [[-NumberofWorkers] <Int32>] [[-WorkerSize] <String>] [[-AseName] <String>]
 [[-AseResourceGroupName] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]
New-AzureRmAppServicePlan [-AppServicePlan] <ServerFarmWithRichSku> [-Location] <String> [[-Tier] <String>]
 [[-NumberofWorkers] <Int32>] [[-WorkerSize] <String>] [[-AseName] <String>] [[-AseResourceGroupName] <String>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

Description

The New-AzureRmAppServicePlan cmdlet creates an Azure App Service plan in a given Geo location with the specified Tier, worker size, and number of workers.

Examples

Example 1: Create an App Service plan

PS C:\>New-AzureRmAppServicePlan -ResourceGroupName "Default-Web-WestUS" -Name "ContosoASP" -location "West US" -Tier Basic -NumberofWorkers 2 -WorkerSize Small

This command creates an App Service plan named ContosoASP in the resource group named Default-Web-WestUS in Geo location West US. The command uses a Basic SKU and allocates two small workers.

Parameters

-Location

Location

Type:String
Required:True
Position:2
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-Tier

Tier

Type:String
Required:False
Position:3
Default value:Free
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-NumberofWorkers

Number Of Workers

Type:Int32
Required:False
Position:4
Default value:1
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-WorkerSize

Size of web worker

Type:String
Required:False
Position:5
Default value:Small
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-AseName

App Service Environment Name

Type:String
Required:False
Position:6
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-AseResourceGroupName

App Service Environment Resource Group Name

Type:String
Required:False
Position:7
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-ResourceGroupName

Resource Group Name

Type:String
Required:True
Position:0
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-Name

App Service Plan Name

Type:String
Required:True
Position:1
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:False
Accept wildcard characters:False
-AppServicePlan

App Service Plan Object

Type:ServerFarmWithRichSku
Required:True
Position:0
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False

Related Links

  • Get-AzureRmAppServicePlan
  • Remove-AzureRmAppServicePlan
  • Set-AzureRmAppServicePlan
